mpmath.name: mpmath
mpmath.description: Python library for arbitrary-precision floating-point arithmetic

repo.name: mpmath
repo.description: Python library for arbitrary-precision floating-point arithmetic

cves.summary: A Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDOS) vulnerability was discovered in Mpmath v1.0.0 when the mpmathify function is called.

readme.summary: The README provides a good introduction to the package and its installation, but lacks clear examples and quick start guides.
readme.top_issue: Lack of a clear quick start guide or basic usage example

injection_risks.description: The use of ast.parse() and eval() can pose a security risk if user input is not properly sanitized.
The run_cell() method executes user-provided code, which may lead to code injection vulnerabilities if not properly validated.

critical_findings: Potential code injection vulnerabilities due to the use of eval() and ast.parse().
Lack of robust input validation and error handling.
security.summary: The mpmath package has some security concerns, including potential code injection vulnerabilities and lack of robust input validation, but overall it appears to be a well-maintained library with no critical secrets exposure or dangerous defaults.
